page.title: 02Community Organisation
page.content: The Braybrooke C.O. was formed in 1959 when it was realised that in a small village of 350 inhabitants it was not feasible for all organisations to arrange major events. All village organisations may join and Youth Club, Church,Chapel,Village Hall,Tiny Tots, Cricket Club,W.I. and Brownies share the profits on a percentage basis. Usually about 1 thousand pounds is available for distribution. A committee of 10 is elected annually and organises a Garden Fete,Waste Paper collection, Harvest Show,Village Tour by Father Christmas and Children's Christmas Parties also occasional Quizzes,Beetle Drives and Teddy Bear's Picnic. The B.C.O. has been very successful not only in raising money but by bringing the community together and introducing newcomers to the village organisations and activities.
